page.title: 07Tourism
page.content: {Lee-on-Solent Butterfly Farm-}is off Stubbington Lane.The farm is on the site of the original Hammond's Nurseries. The farm consists of a souvenir shop and the greenhouses.The two long greenhouses contain many varieties of plants,finches,quails,butterflies and moths.The finches eat aphids and greenfly and the quails eat red spiders, some of these insects cause damage to the plants and the butterflies. The farm was opened in 1984 by Bruce Parker of South Today. The farm is expensive to run and is usually closed to the public in the winter to save on heating costs. Wild life woodcarvings by Derek George are on sale in the shop. Admission charges -ADULTS -Â£1.25 CHILDREN & OAP'S - 85p
